meanings.definition: Not competitive or able to compete
meanings.sent1: The team's performance was uncompetitive in the tournament.
meanings.sent2: Her uncompetitive nature made it difficult for her to succeed in the job market.
meanings.sent3: The turtle's uncompetitive speed in the race was both adorable and predictable.
meanings.sent4: The flower, uncompetitive in size compared to the others, still stood out with its vibrant color.
meanings.sent5: The uncompetitive pricing of the product attracted budget-conscious customers.

meanings.definition: Lacking competitiveness or the ability to compete
meanings.sent1: The company's outdated technology made it uncompetitive in the market.
meanings.sent2: His uncompetitive attitude held him back from reaching his full potential.
meanings.sent3: The uncompetitive squirrel struggled to keep up with its peers during the nut-gathering season.
meanings.sent4: The small boat felt uncompetitive against the massive ships in the harbor.
meanings.sent5: The uncompetitive team failed to secure a spot in the finals due to their lack of skill.
